What's the difference between studying to be a "Developer" (Aka programming) and to study to be in IT (Infra,servers etc)?

Every time I tried to look into some Infra training stuff (like AWS certificates etc), it seems like it's aimed at people who already have to know the gist of programming or be experienced programmers that have deployed their own stuff, meanwhile in programming you just start from 0 in HTML and CSS. I feel like, if you study just "infra/linux" stuff you end up with just a bunch of tools but you really have no idea what they're for unless you had the need of them as a developer. Am I wrong? It just feels like that

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
For example, in some "sysadmin" training programs and stuff, you learn tools like Terraform, Kubernets, Docker and the like, but these tools are also for developers, so then what? That's why I feel like I would just don't have idea what to do with them

I feel like the only standalone thing is Networking engineer stuff, Cisco and the like

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300782
It depends of the field. A pure Systems Administrator only needs to know basic programming to automate tasks with bash.
A pure DevOPS (these are the guys who handle infra stuff) needs moderate programming skills but don't actually code anything. They should only handle the deployments and configure whatever software is required to get the server up and running.
A developer just develops.
The thing is, if you are studying on your own (webshit), you will probably need to know the basics of everything to emulate a production environment and gain experience.

If you want to train for jobs that don't require you to learn a lot of meme technologies to be productive, try Database Administration or Network Administration. Since neither communications or databases have changed in quite a while these trades are pretty focused.

>>1300783
>For example, in some "sysadmin" training programs and stuff, you learn tools like Terraform, Kubernets, Docker and the like, but these tools are also for developers, so then what?
That's because companies want people who are able to do anything so they don't have to hire professionals.
>ex. fullstack "developers"

posts.com:
>>1300745
If you install the Creative Cloud version, you want to keep the software from phoning home and trying to connect with the Adobe servers, because that can lead to a message that your trial has run out and you have to subscribe. To avoid this, you unplug from the internet, install the software, and then head over to your Windows firewall (assuming you're on Windows) and block every .exe you find in the Adobe folders from connecting to the internet.
See here: https://www.wikihow.com/Block-a-Program-with-Windows-Firewall
When you're done with this, reconnect to the internet and have fun.

What is it about?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300827
Takes place in ancient (Neronian) Rome. He's a Roman war hero, she's a foreign Christian. He's attracted to her beauty and grace, and is confused about what makes her personality so different. She has internal conflict because the path of debauchery he's leading her down violates her convictions, but she's really attracted to him and hopes she can change him. The setting provides a lot of action (it's no spoiler, everyone knows Nero burned down Rome). Personally I found the climax both exciting and satisfying, and there were a lot of interesting characters. If you're not religious be aware the author was obviously very pious, but he won the Nobel Prize for this book and for good reason.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300405
>Do certain brands last longer than others?
Yes.
Rough tier list:
- Dedicated ruggedised laptop (toughbook, etc.)
- Thinkpad
- non-Thinkpad Business laptop: Latitude, Satellite Pro, Thinkpad Edge/Thinkpad E
- Gaming laptops (though arguably they don't fit in the tier list at all)
- generic Dell, HP consumer laptops (Inspiron, Pavilion, Satellite)
- anything made by a brand beginning with "A"

Unfortunately it's really difficult to find manga raws in high quality, even digital raws from Amazon can be mediocre. Your best bet for raws are usually manga-zip and nyaa.si.

As for readers, I'd recommend an e-reader for manga. The kindle paperwhite is good, but you have to convert all of your manga beforehand with Kindle Comic Convertor. If you're willing to shell out the Meebook P78 Pro is excellent; it runs android so it supports all archived manga formats by default, if you decide on that I'd recommend the Perfect Viewer app from the Play Store.

Chinese piracy sites have some regular manga raws for free. The remainder of the manga titles and the highest quality scans are behind their paywall which requires you to earn tokens for access. You can buy tokens of course as a convenience and they encourage that.

I used a cheapass android tablet for reading. It was horribly uncomfy because I had to keep cleaning the screen and it felt as cheap as it was. On the other hand it was 100% capable of reading manga quickly and efficently but I got tired of using it due to how shoddy it was. E-readers are pretty awful for manga since they can't display color when need be and struggle with images/pdfs, but if you do find one that works with color/images properly then those e-ink screens have a much better feel than tablet screens do.

posts.com:
Not exactly what you had in mind, but I recommend a vertical monitor.

I have a rotating one (that I always keep in portrait mode) and it's perfect to read manga, books and also to watch vertical videos when phonetoddlers post them.

Not very easy to find HD Raws, but the screen is big enough to read everything without any scrolling, so any image viewer works. I dropped my manga-reading programs and now I just use Irfanview.

I'm also far-sighted, so having a huge manga page is kind on my eyes.

That's why you port your old number to the new provider, instead of getting a new one.
Bar that, you should have switched to TOTP 2FA instead of staying with SMS 2FA, before changing number.

- manage to get your old number back,
- or have the backup codes you should have written down when setting up 2FA,
your account is as good as gone.

With Google, you will never manage to get a human to look at your problem.

The filename of a Twitter photo also contains a base64-encoded snowflake ID. This can be decoded into a regular snowflake ID, although it contains three "extra" unknown bytes.
For example,
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q?format=jpg
FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q -> 1572620320212922371

It is unknown if the filename of a Twitter video also contains a snowflake ID. You can see the URL contains it, but any off-platform video would would only contain the file name.
For example,
https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1564378065198882816/pu/vid/960x720/ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK.mp4

How would "ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK" be decoded into a snowflake, if it's possible?

https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#snowflakes (good visualizations, twitter uses another epoch)

>>1300376
>Am I correct in thinking that as long as the motherboard has slots for everything I want that it doesn't really matter which one I go for or is there anything else I should be considering?
Processor features are now tied to what motherboard you purchased: the processor checks and disables them if you didn't pay enough.
Intel does this with overclocking: even with a K-processor, you can't fiddle with the multiplier unless you have a Z motherboard.
AMD does it with PCI Express: even though it's the CPU that generates high-speed PCIe lanes, the chipset isn't involved, and the motherboard's sole involvement is providing 40 pairs of wires, AMD processors will disable their PCIe 4.0/5.0 support if you didn't pay for at least a B550.

Anyways, what you should do is find someone who assembled a PC that they're happy with, and copy that. Or buy one from a local store.

Some motherboard manufacturers tried adding support for PCIe 4.0 on X470/B450, but the signal wasn't stable enough, so they disabled it in the end.

>the motherboard's sole involvement is providing 40 pairs of wires
High speed digital signals are a bitch and a half to get right.
It's not just a matter of plugging wires together.
You need them all to be right length, the right width, as well as the right distance from the ground plane and one another.
If the PCB isn't engineered for PCIe 4.0 speeds, it's just not happening.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300521
>i could buy an i7 4790k
That's a perfectly cromulent solution if you can get one for $90-100 and set the
multiplier to 4.4GHz all cores, the power limit to 100W and the turbo duration to all-day. This is achievable with a cheap motherboard, air cooling, and otherwise stock settings, including stock voltage. This is on-par with a 3200G/3300X, despite 3xxx being six years newer.

You need a wanky motherboard to overclock a 4790K properly, but any random B85 will be able to set the all-cores multiplier, which is entirely adequate.

>i'll have to change my motherboard ram and cpu for the next upgrade anyway
Yeah but you'll do that anyway, and you'll probably have to change the PSU to get ATX 3.0 for whatever GPU's around then, and you'd have to get that GPU, and all that leaves is the case and some old drives that you should replace for reliability and performance reasons, so really you should just get a case as well, and find someone to give/sell your old PC to. Upgrading is a scam, unless your PC has an obvious deficiency that it shouldn't have had in the first place.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300692
>i'll just get a 4790k and upgrade again in a few years
Don't forget to look in your BIOS and see what overclocking options you have. Unless you have an expensive enthusiast motherboard with a z-chipset, you probably can't set the voltage in the BIOS (but you might be able to in Throttlestop). What you almost always can do is set the multipliers. 4790k is 4.4/4.3/4.2/4.1GHz depending on how many cores are busy, but you can set it to 4.4/4.4/4.4/4.4GHz and it's not even really an overclock, more of an over-TDP. So long as you've got a halfway decent cooler, this is a super-easy way to get 5-8% more performance for absolutely nothing.

While residing at the Bhesakala wood, the Buddha uttered Verse157with reference to Prince Bodhi:

Once, Prince Bodhi built a magnificent palace for himself. When the palace was finished he invited the Buddha for alms-food. For this special occasion, he had the building decorated and perfumed with four kinds of scents and incense. Also, a long carpet was spread on the floor, starting from the threshold to the interior of the room. Then, because he had no children, the prince made a solemn asseveration that if he were to have any children the Buddha should step on the cloth.

When the Buddha came, Prince Bodhi respectfully requested the Buddha three times to enter the room. But the Buddha, instead of moving, only looked at Ananda. Ananda understood him and so asked Prince Bodhi to remove the cloth from the door-step. Then only, the Buddha entered the palace. The prince then offered delicious and choice food to the Buddha. After the meal, the prince asked the Buddha why he did not step on the cloth.

The Buddha in turn asked the prince whether he had spread the cloth making a solemn asseveration that if he were to be blessed with a child, the Buddha would step on it; and the prince replied in the affirmative. To him, the Buddha said that he and his wife were not going to have any children because of their past evil deeds. The Buddha then related their past story.

In one of their past existences, the prince and his wife were the sole survivors of a shipwreck. They were stranded on a deserted island, and there they lived by eating birds' eggs, little chicks and birds, without any feeling of remorse at any time. For that evil deed, they would not be blessed with any children. If they had felt even a slight remorse for their deed at any stage of their lives, they could have a child or two in this existence. Then turning to the prince, the Buddha said, "One who loves himself should guard himself in all stages of life, or at least, during one stage in his life."

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300285
Afaik you just skip column names that you don't want to insert data into. Only the primary key is needed to be inserted. When you create the table you can use DEFAULT keyword to specify a default value in a column if you need to.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1300285
Depends on how the sql table is made, if the data you want to ommit is made to accept null, then you can just add the fields you are going to use, and their values.

>INSERT INTO phpbb3.phpbb_users (user_type, username) VALUES ('admin', 'JOHN DOE')

if the ommited values accept null, then they will be inserted as null by default.

You can also set a default value on the table structure if you don't want it to be null (that must be done from the sql client, with alter table).
https://www.w3schools.com/sql/sql_alter.asp

>explain my subtext to you
better yet, I'll explain to OP how to solve his problem

windows key + x, then press i to open a terminal
type python3 and press enter, the Windows store will open automatically and take you through an installation process

if you don't have ffmpeg installed, you need that too:
https://ffmpeg.org/download.html

then back in your terminal, paste this line and press enter:
pip install git+https://github.com/openai/whisper.git

then run this line:
whisper C:\Users\blah\audio.wav
change the path to wherever your audio file is

there, that's it.

also the article said you need to enable something like in the pic, but I've never seen that before.
when something goes wrong post a screenshot of it or paste the error message here

posts.name: Anonymous

Yeah that's what I'm using, yt-dlp. Can you elaborate on pic rel? Not sure I understand what this 'archive file' is and how it's generated.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1299013
For example, if you run the script
>yt-dlp --download-archive archive.txt https://www.youtube.com/@bisnap/videos
then the program will (1) download all the videos on that page and (2) record all the IDs of the downloaded videos in the file archive.txt. If you run the same script again (e. g., through a daily cron job), then the program will skip downloading any videos whose IDs are already listed in archive.txt.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1299017
And, if you've already downloaded a bunch of videos prior to beginning to use the "download-archive" option, you can use the "dateafter" option to filter stuff that was uploaded before a certain date.

>>1300089
I think you got the wrong thread/board.

Anyways, the problem isn't the conceptual design of a projectile-style physics package, anyone with an engineering degree could make one of those, the problem is enriching Uranium. You can do that in one of three ways:
- in a breeder reactor, the downside of which being you need to already have enriched uranium and a nuclear reactor
- in a Calutron, which is basically a factory-complex-sized mass-spectrometer. This is what was used in the Manhattan Project, and the whole process was so complicated and fascinating it's worth reading the whole thing: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calutron . Spoiler: they used 6,000 TONS of silver, because the war couldn't spare 6000 tons of copper
- centrifuging Uranium Tetrafluoride. This is how it's done nowadays. UTF is probably the worst chemical that can possibly exist, it's worth reading the Material Safety Data Sheet if you've got a thing for dark nerd humour. I particularly liked "Observe all Federal, State and local Regulations when disposing of this substance", given how it's controlled as a precursor to nuclear weapons, radioactive, poisonous (because of the uranium), poisonous (because of the fluorine), corrosive, carcinogenic, and borderline explosive.
https://www.energy.gov/sites/prod/files/2020/11/f80/SDS-Uranium_Hexafluoride_UF6_2020.pdf
You have to heat it until it's a gas, then centrifuge the gas. Heat it but don't let it catch fire, there's very few substances that will put it out. Water turns it into hydrofluoric acid, which will eat through your flesh, then react with your bones and turn your bones into poison. You need to do this with hundreds of tons of this stuff to get enough enriched uranium to make a gun-type warhead.
